awd_titl_txt: Corridor Aerogeophysics of the Southeastern Ross Transect   Zone:  Airborne Gravity
awd_abstract_narration: Investigators from the Naval Research Laboratory and Lamont-                    Doherty Geological Observatory will integrate airborne                          gravity measurement with the combined airborne radar and                        aeromagnetic Corridor Aerogeophysics of the Southeastern                        Ross Transect Zone (CASERTZ) program.  This program will                        survey two 220 x 330 km regions between the Transantarctic                      Mountains and Marie Byrd Land during the 1990-1991 and 1991-                    1992 field seasons.  The survey will consist of a normal                        5 x 5 km track spacing and will be designed to determine the                    motion, volcanism and deformation history of the Ellsworth-                     Whitmore crustal block of West Antarctic and the                                relationship of the tectonics of this block to the evolution                    of the Byrd Subglacial Basin, the Interior Ross Embayment                       and the Transantarctic Mountains.  The airborne gravimentry                     will improve the capability to model crustal thickness.                                                                                                         The airborne gravity system will consist of a modified BGM-                     3 gravimeter and carrier-phase GPS.  Secondary measurement                      sources will include precision pressure altimetry and raw                       inertial sensor data as aids to the primary measurement                         sources.

inst.inst_name: Department of Navy Naval Research Laboratory
